div.bibl: Chicagoer Arbeiter Zeitung, Monday, August 18th, 1879. The Platt German National Festival

body.p: commenced yesterday in Ogden's Grove and continued through to-day. A grand procession took place whose main attraction was the beautifully decorated floats which presented pictures of the old country.
The festive procession then, proceeded to the Picnic Grounds, where a lively entertainment soon developed.
In the afternoon Ex-Alderman S, Dr. Busch and William Eschenburg addressed the excursionists in Low German.
The rest of the program consisted of Concert, Dance and a Peasant marriage.
